item.description:
Quick Links

  • Space Sprint Monopoly GO Rewards And Milestones
  • Space Sprint Monopoly GO Leaderboard Rewards

With the final lap of the Floral Face-Off tournament, Scopely has dropped a brand-new tournament: Space Sprint. It runs alongside the Rocket to Success solo event and will keep players engaged for one day.

Monopoly GO has also released Rocket Partners, and the Space Sprint tournament offers a ton of Battery Tokens needed for the Partners event. This detailed guide will cover all the rewards available in the Space Sprint Monopoly GO tournament, along with their respective milestones.

How To Get Points in Space Sprint Monopoly GO

Your goal in the Space Sprint tournament is to land your token on the Railroad tiles of your board. Completing all milestones will get you 4,255 dice rolls and five sticker packs.

Here are the default points for the Shutdown and Bank Heist mini-games during the Space Spring tournament:

Shutdown

  • Blocked: Two Points
  • Successful: Four Points.

Bank Heist

  • Small: Four Points
  • Large: Six Points
  • Bankrupt: Eight Points.

item.title: Dragon Age: The Veilguard Reveals $220 Collector's Edition
item.description:
Highlights

  • Dragon Age: The Veilguard Rooks Coffer Edition is available to order exclusively from GameStop for $220.
  • The collector's edition includes the game, numerous cosmetics, a Light-up Lyrium Dagger, a Companion Litho Print, a map of Thedas with a quiver tube, Rook's Deck, a Potion Flask, and an Enchanted Die.
  • Fans can also purchase these goods directly from BioWare for only $150, but this bundle doesn't include the game itself.

BioWare has recently revealed Dragon Age: The Veilguard Rooks Coffer Edition for PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X/S. This collector’s edition will cost $220 and include several additional goods for hardcore Dragon Age: The Veilguard fans.

Dragon Age: The Veilguard finally has an official release date: October 31, 2024. The recent trailer revealed more information about the upcoming action RPG, including some glimpses of the enemies that players will battle during the lengthy story and confirming the appearance of fan-favorite characters such as the mage Morrigan.

BioWare has unveiled the first details about Dragon Age: The Veilguard Rooks Coffer Edition , which is being sold for $220 exclusively at GameStop for PS5 and Xbox Series X/S. This edition will include a selection of cosmetics, including three Rook Armor Sets, seven Rook weapons, seven Companion armor sets, and seven Companion weapons. Apart from the game itself and select in-game items, the collection also includes a Light-up Lyrium Dagger, a Companion Litho Print featuring the characters found in The Veilguard , a beautiful map of Thedas with a quiver tube, Rook's Deck, a Potion Flask, and an Enchanted Die. Alternatively, gamers can purchase these goods directly from BioWare for only $150. However, the $150 edition does not include the game, only the physical goods.

What Is Included In Dragon Age: The Veilguard Rooks Coffer Edition?

  • All cosmetics from the Deluxe Edition (three Rook Armor Sets, seven Rook weapons, seven Companion armor sets, seven Companion weapons)
  • Light-up Lyrium Dagger
  • Companion Litho Print
  • Thedas Map with Quiver Tube
  • Rook's Deck
  • Potion Flask
  • Enchanted Die

As The Veilguard ’s release draws near, BioWare continues to release more details about the game. A few weeks ago, the developers revealed the size of Dragon Age: The Veilguard ’s script, which will boast over 140,000 lines of dialogue. This is much wordier than its predecessor, Dragon Age: Inquisition , which only had 88,000 lines.

BioWare also recently confirmed the voice actors for Dragon Age: The Veilguard . The list includes big names such as Alex Jordan ( Cyberpunk 2077 ), Jeff Berg ( Persona 3 Reload , Battlefield 1 ), Bryony Corrigan ( Baldur’s Gate 3 ), and Erika Ishii ( Destiny 2 , Apex Legends ) as the voice actors for Rook, the game's main character. The voice actors for the game’s companions have also been revealed, including Jee Young Han as Bellara, Matthew Mercer as Manfred, and Zach Mendez as Lucanis.

Hopefully, Dragon Age: The Veilguard will rise to become one of the best BioWare games after its highly anticipated release almost a decade after the last entry to the franchise. The Veilguard ’s marketing materials have had a somewhat mixed reception so far, with some fans criticizing the game’s art style and action-focused gameplay, while others are excited about the new companions and the long-awaited continuation of the story started in Inquisition .

item.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops 6's Theater Mode Could Be a Community Game-Changer
item.description:
Highlights

  • Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 is bringing back the Theater Mode from past CoD games.
  • Theater Mode allows players to view past games with unique camera angles and capture clips of highlight plays.
  • Theater Mode in Black Ops 6 could drive community engagement and competition in a big way if Treyarch leans into supporting it.

An almost overwhelming amount of information has been released regarding Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 in recent weeks, including a huge reveal of the upcoming project's Zombies mode that was shown to fans on August 8. Of course, a lot of information about the title also came out during its worldwide reveal following the Xbox Games Showcase on June 9, although this largely focused on the characters and core mechanics of the game's campaign mode.

That said, there's still more to learn about the multiplayer experience of Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 , and it seems that this will finally happen during the Call of Duty NEXT presentation on August 28. Some very important elements of Black Ops 6 's multiplayer have already been confirmed by Treyarch, however, such as the return of the franchise's iconic Theater Mode in the upcoming game. Long-time fans of Call of Duty will know just how exciting it is to see the return of Theater Mode, and if Treyarch implements it correctly, then Black Ops 6 could have a sense of community involvement and competition that it most certainly needs.

Black Ops 6 could just be home to the most popular version of Theater Mode that the Call of Duty franchise has ever seen.

Treyarch Should Lean Into the Community Benefits of Theater Mode in Black Ops 6

Theater Mode was first introduced to the Call of Duty franchise with 2010's Black Ops , allowing players to re-watch their most recent games from a range of angles and player perspectives. In a time before widespread console DVR capabilities, this allowed players to capture, save, and upload their most hilarious or impressive Call of Duty moments, making Theater Mode a staple mechanic of the 2010 release.

Following the popularity of Theater Mode, the mechanic would go on to appear throughout the Black Ops franchise as well as the original Modern Warfare 3. Treyarch recently confirmed that Theater Mode will also be present in Black Ops 6 when it launches on October 25. While instant clip-recording is now a staple of modern consoles and PC platforms to an extent, there is still a definite use for Theater Mode, with the ability to track things like cross-map throwing knives being just one of them.

The main potential utility of Theater Mode in Black Ops 6 is the way it could create a sense of community in the game, with Theater Mode hopefully coming with a hub where players can upload and showcase their most attention-grabbing clips and screenshots. If this is implemented in the right way, then the most popular clips could rise to the forefront of the Theater Mode hub through a trending tab, allowing the CoD community to directly influence which clips are considered to be the best of the best.

Theater Mode Could Become a Key Part of Black Ops 6's Content Cycle

Treyarch could then hold monthly or even weekly competitions that reward the most popular clips for that time period, perhaps giving the creators of these clips rewards in the way of unique cosmetics or CoD Points. If Treyarch makes these potential rewards attractive enough, then Black Ops 6 could just be home to the most popular version of Theater Mode that the Call of Duty franchise has ever seen.

It is no secret that CoD 's sense of community has waned in recent years thanks to things like the reduced necessity of game chat. Treyarch has been presented with a golden opportunity to really lean into a feature that has the game's playerbase as its lifeblood. By giving power to the players in creating clips and deciding which ones are the most impressive across both multiplayer and Zombies, Black Ops 6 's Theater Mode could see the franchise's community flourish in a way that has not been seen for some time.

item.title: Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 Officially Hit With Release Date Delay
item.description:
Highlights

  • Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 has been delayed to February 11, 2025, but it will be showcased at Gamescom with a new trailer and gameplay footage.
  • The sequel promises to build on the historical accuracy and first-person melee combat of the original game, providing exciting new features.
  • The delay to 2025 allows RPG fans some breathing room amidst this fall's busy release schedule, but positions it against Avowed, which launches on February 18.

Warhorse Studios has given a big update on its upcoming Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 RPG, revealing its delayed release date, and letting fans know what to expect from the game at Gamescom next week. Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 was originally slated to come out sometime later this year as one of 2024's largest RPG releases, but its release date was recently leaked online, pointing toward a delay to next year.

Kingdom Come: Deliverance was Warhorse Studios' very first game, which released in 2018 to largely positive reception from RPG fans. The narrative-driven medieval RPG was praised for its commitment to historical accuracy, putting players in the Kingdom of Bohemia and featuring satisfying and grounded first-person melee combat. Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 looks to continue the story of the first game with a variety of gameplay improvements, new features, and more.

Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 has finally divulged its release date, though some fans may be disappointed. In a two-minute video posted to Twitter, Warhorse Studios announced that Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 has been delayed to 2025, and will be released on February 11, a few days off from the release anniversary of the first game. Warhorse also confirmed that it'll have a huge presence at this upcoming Gamescom, with a new Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 trailer at Geoff Keighley's Opening Night Live. A 20-minute slice of gameplay footage will be shown off during Gamescom week, as well as the full unveiling of Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 's collector's edition.

Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 Release Date

  • February 11, 2025

Considering the heavy hitters that are set to release this Fall, like Assassin's Creed Shadows , Metaphor: Re-Fantazio , Greedfall 2 's early access, and others, moving such a big RPG like Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 out of the way to next year is surely a relief for RPG fans who will likely have their plates full this Fall season. Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 's February 11 release date puts it just one week ahead of the release of Obsidian Entertainment's highly anticipated fantasy RPG Avowed , on February 18. It'll be interesting to see which title RPG fans gravitate towards. While both are first-person fantasy RPGs, they each offer different experiences, as Avowed features heavy fantasy elements, while Kingdom Come: Deliverance is strictly medieval. In terms of direct competition, Avowed 's availability on Xbox Game Pass will free up many RPG fans to also purchase Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 .

Eager fans awaiting Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 should keep an eye on Gamescom next week for the game's appearance at Opening Night Live on August 20, its 20-minute gameplay slice, and the details of the game's collector's edition contents. Gamers who have yet to play the first game will now have plenty more time to do so before the sequel drops on February 11.

item.title: A Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers Side Quest Could Inspire Cute Tales of the Shire Content
item.description:
Highlights

  • Tales of the Shire may feature cameos from various non-Hobbit creatures and characters, given that it's already known to involve Gandalf.
  • The game should incorporate a subplot about Merry and Pippin interacting with the Ents as a reference to The Two Towers.
  • Inter-region exploration in Middle-earth can enhance gameplay variety and engage players in new adventures.

Many longtime fans of The Lord of the Rings have always wanted to experience how the Hobbits live, and they can soon do it in the cozy game Tales of the Shire . Set in Bywater, Tales of the Shire lets players create their own Hobbit who will help the town flourish through missions, friendship-building, and more.

Although Tales of the Shire seems to be mostly Hobbit-centric, there's still a possibility that it will feature cameos from other Lord of the Rings races, such as Elves and Dwarves. There's also one entity from the saga that would be an awesome addition to the game: the mighty Ent.

Tales of the Shire Shouldn't Ignore One of Lord of the Rings' Most Memorable Subplots

In The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers , Merry and Pippin get separated from the Fellowship and find themselves in the protection of Treebeard and the Ents, which are tree-like creatures. It's an interesting subplot that showcases wholesome conversations between the Hobbits and the Ents, which later leads to the tree creatures helping the Fellowship to attack and destroy the forces of Isengard.

With Tales of the Shire already simulating what life is like for a Hobbit, it would be interesting to see content inspired by memorable events in Lord of the Rings , such as interactions with the Ents. If Tales of the Shire allowed players to interact with the Ents, it would mean opening up other regions of Middle-earth, so the Hobbit could venture out to Fangorn Forest and other areas where the Ents reside.

According to Lord of the Rings lore, the Ents can be found in Fangorn Forest, Eriador, East Beleriand, and Treegarth of Orthanc.

It would be interesting to see if Tales of the Shire will let players venture off to other regions in Middle-earth, especially the lesser-known ones. Hobbits are known to be friendly and adventurous, so this would be a great way to showcase these qualities. Plus, they could discover other quests and mini-games beyond Bywater and also meet and befriend interesting characters. Perhaps the Ents can task the Hobbits with helping take care of the forest and the creatures that live in them to maintain a sense of harmony. Even without a travel option, it's still possible for Tales of the Shire to incorporate Ents through mini-games, conversations between Hobbits, and books that further expand the game's universe.

Exploration Can Be Key to Tales of the Shire's Success

Most cozy farming and life sims are limited to one location, as they follow the protagonists' flourishing life and the positive domino effect on the surrounding villagers. In Tales of the Shire , it seems like the game might stick to exploring Bywater for farming materials, food, and cooking ingredients to improve the main Hobbit's living experience. However, there's a real opportunity for Tales of the Shire to allow inter-region exploration to add more variety to crops, dishes, and more.

This is already a feature that games like Coral Island have adopted. It's been teased before that Coral Island will one day allow players to go island hopping, where they can encounter new people and items to bring home to their farm. The feature isn't out yet, but the closest that players have gotten is the ability to live and thrive in the Merfolk Kingdom, as they can unlock the ability to cultivate a farm and take care of sea creatures underwater, and players can carry the items to the surface as consumables and gifts.

Middle-earth is a vast world with different kinds of people, making it possible to have more cozy games based on Lord of the Rings . But Tales of the Shire can get the ball rolling with regions like Fanghorn Forest to give players another perspective on Hobbit life and adventure.
